changes.summary:
The following sections have been amended to include the introduction of scheduled level 1 only auctions:

4.5.2 – Added a new ‘Top of Book Message’ which will disseminate top of book changes when the system is in a scheduled level 1 only auction.

4.9.4 - Added new enum ‘G - Scheduled Level 1 Only Auction’ for the ‘Trading Status’ field of the Symbol Status message

4.9.13 - Added the new enum ‘G – Scheduled Level 1 Only Auction’ for the ‘Auction Type’ field of the Auction Trade message

4.9.16 - Added the new enum ‘G – Scheduled Level 1 Only Auction’ for the ‘Auction Type’ field of the Auction Info message

4.9.18 – Added ‘Top of Book’ message table

history.summary:
The following sections have been amended for clarification. Note that there are no MITCH interface changes as a result of Release 8.7 :

3.1.1 and 3.1.2 – Added cross reference to Market Data Parameters Guide. Clarified description of system behaviour if additional client messages are sent before the exchange of logon messages.

4.8.5 – Clarified the meaning of the sequence number. Correction to Instrument ID description on snapshot complete message.

4.9.14 – Removed Late Trade Bit as not used..

The following sections have been amended to support the new Cross Order functionality and additional amendments.

2.2 Clarification on the number of connections allowed per compID

3.1.1 Further clarifications around logon behaviour to the Replay service

3.1.2 Further clarifications around logon behaviour to the Recovery service and response expected from the server before and after 07:00.

4.9.12 Conversion of a current reserved field to the Cross Type field to support the new Cross Order functionality See MIT902 – Cross Orders Message Change Guidelines for full details on all changes.

Amended for rebranding ITCH to MITCH

Added Appendix C for Negative value conversion of price field

datatypes.name: Alpha
datatypes.description: These fields use standard ASCII character bytes. They are left justified and padded on the right with spaces.

datatypes.name: BitField
datatypes.description: A single byte used to hold up to eight 1-bit flags. Each bit will represent a Boolean flag. The 0 bit is the lowest significant bit and the 7 bit is the highest significant bit.

datatypes.name: Byte(ASCII)
datatypes.description: A single byte used to hold one ASCII character.

datatypes.name: Byte(Hex)
datatypes.description: A single byte used to hold one binary character.

datatypes.name: Date
datatypes.description: Date specified in the YYYYMMDD format using ASCII characters.

datatypes.name: Price
datatypes.description: Signed Little-Endian encoded eight byte integer field with eight implied decimal places.

datatypes.name: Time
datatypes.description: Time specified in the HH:MM:SS format using ASCII characters.

symbology.name: Symbology
symbology.description:
Customer should feel free to send any of the following symbol identifiers in field 55:

  • RIC
  • Exchange code
  • Bloomberg code

market-hours.name: Market Hours
market-hours.description:
Participants may connect to the system from 05:00 local time, and place orders from 06:00.

The market will open with an auction at 08:30, and close with an aution at 16:30 local time.

All connected sessions will be disconnected at 22:00 local time.

fields.name: Halt Reason
fields.description: Reason for the trading halt. This field will contain only spaces if Trading Status is not â€œHâ€, or if the reason is unknown.

fields.name: New End Time
fields.description: New time the session will end. Will only be stamped if the session change was not in the original schedule e.g. AESP auction call or unscheduled session. For all other cases a space will be stamped on this field. New End Time will be in terms of the local market time (i.e. not UTC).

fields.name: Trade Type
fields.description: Type of off-book trade. See Appendix B.

fields.name: Trade Time
fields.description: Time off-book trade was executed. Time will be specified in UTC.

fields.name: Trade Date
fields.description: Date off-book trade was executed.

fields.name: Traded Currency
fields.description: Currency in which an off book trade has occurred other than for the trading currency of the relevant instrument.The possible values will be the ISO 4217 codes for currency. However the following values will also be disseminated: GBX = GB Pennies

fields.name: Original Price
fields.description: Price in the execution currency. The field should contain only zeroes if the trade did not take place in a currency other than for the trading currency of the instrument.

fields.name: Execution Venue
fields.description: The possible values will be the ISO 10383 codes for Exchange ID. However the following values too will be disseminated: EXPA, SI, XOFF.

workflows.name: LSE MITCH Recovery
workflows.description: This workflow models market data recovery mechanism.

states.description: User is not connected or disconnected
User is successfully connected
Request is Accepted
Request is Rejected
All snapshot updates have been sent

transitions.description: Submit request for recovery on instrument
Submit request for recovery on segment

workflows.name: LSE MITCH Replay
workflows.description: This workflow models market data replay mechanism.

states.description: User is not connected or disconnected
User is successfully connected
Request is Accepted
Request is Rejected

workflows.name: LSE MITCH Market Status
workflows.description: This workflow models the state of the market.

states.description: Market is closed
Market is Open

workflows.name: LSE MITCH trading cycle for SETS-L1
workflows.description: This workflow models change of status for SETS-L1 instruments

states.description: Instrument is in Pre-Trading Phase
Instrument is in Opening Auction Call Phase
Instrument is in Regular Trading Phase
Instrument is in EDSP Auction Call Phase
Instrument is in Periodic Auction Call Phase
Instrument is in Closing Auction Call Phase
Instrument is in Closing Price Publication Phase
Instrument is in Closing Price Crossing Session Phase
Instrument is in Post Close Phase
Instrument trading is closed
Instrument trading is halted. No order entry,or executions. Order deletion permitted.

transitions.description: Instrument moves to Opening Auction Call
Instrument moves to ESDP auction call
Instrument moves to Periodic auction call
Instrument moves to Closing auction call
Instrument moves to Closing Price Publication
Instrument moves to Closing Price Crossing Session

workflows.name: LSE MITCH life of a displayed anonymous order
workflows.description: This workflow models order book updates for the life of displayed anonymous order.

states.description: Initial state when we are waiting for the next market data action.
An anonymous limit or market order is added to the order book.
An anonymous limit or market order is updated and keeps its time priority.
An anonymous limit or market order is updated and loses its time priority.
Indicates that the displayed portion of an order is fully or partially filled at its displayed price. The executed quantity is included in the message.
The remainder of a displayed order is cancelled.

transitions.description: Displayed anomymous Order is updated without losing its time priority
Displayed anomymous Order is updated and loses its time priority
